snippet: The Supreme Court temporarily barred the government from enforcing against a Christian college a contraception rule under the Affordable Care Act, drawing a furious dissent from the three female justices, who said the court had broken a promise.
abstract: Supreme Court sides 5-to-4 with religiously affiliated nonprofit groups in clash between religious freedom and women's rights; decision, which prompts furious dissent from Justices Sonia Sotomayor, Ruth Bader Ginsburg and Elena Kagan, temporarily exempts Wheaton College from part of regulations that provide contraceptive coverage under Affordable Care Act.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court temporarily barred the government from enforcing against a Christian college a contraception rule under the Affordable Care Act, drawing a furious dissent from the three female justices, who said the court had broken a promise.

headline.main: Birth Control Order Deepens Divide Among Justices
headline.print_headline: Birth Control Deepens Divide Among Justices

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
